hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime following a liquidity shock, a sharp 1-day spike in BTC price (>4%) on below-average volume is likely to be faded, with price retracing >50% of the spike's range within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a fragile, post-shock liquidity environment, large moves on low volume are suspect and often driven by illiquid order book sweeps or isolated large orders, not sustained buying interest. The market lacks the depth to support the move.
entry_conditions: BTC trading volume for spike day < 20-day median volume
Spike occurs after a 5-day period where BTC realized volatility (20h) was below 40% annualized

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to 61.8% Fibonacci level of the prior day's range (high to low)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes above the high of the spike day

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 3-day return after entry conditions is positive, or price closes above spike day high more than 35% of the time.
